column4: I have a ton of OOo2 packages in '.deb' files. How would i go about installing all of them?
will dpkg figure out what to install first, last, etc?
In general, you're better off using aptitude or synaptic.
...why'd you d/l the packages instead of 'aptitude install ... ' ?
the ones that are there are pretty old (m79), current is m100. is it not a big deal?
Learn to love and trust your package manager.
What OS are you coming from?
I've been messing with linux for about a year
What APT (A Package Tool), Ubuntu's package manager, buys you, is resolving dependencies between packages.
If you go outside of it, you're taking a risk of getting incompatible stuff on your system.
IME, going for the latest and greatest rarely provides compelling advantages.
last time. I promise :). hope nothing got screwed up too bad
actually, I cant find where the packages just installed
If they're DEBs and built for Ubuntu, you may be OK.  There are third party repositories, I use a few.
i doubt they are. I got them from the site
IMVAO, the one Ubuntu provides you.
